SRVF Geodesic ComputationÔÉÅ

geodesic calculation for SRVF (curves) open and closed

moduleauthor:: J. Derek Tucker <jdtuck@sandia.gov>

geodesic.back_parallel_transport(u1, alpha, basis, T=100, k=5)[source]ÔÉÅ

backwards parallel translates q1 and q2 along manifold

Parameters

  • u1 ‚Äì numpy ndarray of shape (2,M) of M samples

  • alpha ‚Äì numpy ndarray of shape (2,M) of M samples

  • basis ‚Äì list numpy ndarray of shape (2,M) of M samples

  • T ‚Äì Number of samples of curve (Default = 100)

  • k ‚Äì number of samples along path (Default = 5)

Return type

numpy ndarray

Return utilde

translated vector

geodesic.find_basis_normal_path(alpha, k=5)[source]ÔÉÅ

computes orthonormalized basis vectors to the normal space at each of the k points (q-functions) of the path alpha

Parameters

  • alpha ‚Äì numpy ndarray of shape (2,M) of M samples (path)

  • k ‚Äì number of samples along path (Default = 5)

Return type

numpy ndarray

Return basis

basis vectors along the path

geodesic.geod_sphere(beta1, beta2, k=5, scale=False, rotation=True, center=True)[source]ÔÉÅ

This function calculates the geodesics between open curves beta1 and beta2 with k steps along path

Parameters

  • beta1 ‚Äì numpy ndarray of shape (2,M) of M samples

  • beta2 ‚Äì numpy ndarray of shape (2,M) of M samples

  • k ‚Äì number of samples along path (Default = 5)

  • scale ‚Äì include length (Default = False)

  • rotation ‚Äì include rotation (Default = True)

  • center ‚Äì center curves at origin (Default = True)

Return type

numpy ndarray

Return dist

geodesic distance

Return path

geodesic path

geodesic.init_path_geod(beta1, beta2, T=100, k=5)[source]ÔÉÅ

Initializes a path in \(\cal{C}\). beta1, beta2 are already standardized curves. Creates a path from beta1 to beta2 in shape space, then projects to the closed shape manifold.

Parameters

  • beta1 ‚Äì numpy ndarray of shape (2,M) of M samples (first curve)

  • beta2 ‚Äì numpy ndarray of shape (2,M) of M samples (end curve)

  • T ‚Äì Number of samples of curve (Default = 100)

  • k ‚Äì number of samples along path (Default = 5)

Return type

numpy ndarray

Return alpha

a path between two q-functions

Return beta

a path between two curves

Return O

rotation matrix

geodesic.init_path_rand(beta1, beta_mid, beta2, T=100, k=5)[source]ÔÉÅ

Initializes a path in \(\cal{C}\). beta1, beta_mid beta2 are already standardized curves. Creates a path from beta1 to beta_mid to beta2 in shape space, then projects to the closed shape manifold.

Parameters

  • beta1 ‚Äì numpy ndarray of shape (2,M) of M samples (first curve)

  • betamid ‚Äì numpy ndarray of shape (2,M) of M samples (mid curve)

  • beta2 ‚Äì numpy ndarray of shape (2,M) of M samples (end curve)

  • T ‚Äì Number of samples of curve (Default = 100)

  • k ‚Äì number of samples along path (Default = 5)

Return type

numpy ndarray

Return alpha

a path between two q-functions

Return beta

a path between two curves

Return O

rotation matrix

<<<<<<< HEAD geodesic.path_straightening(beta1, beta2, betamid=None, init='rand', T=100, k=5)[source]ÔÉÅ
======= geodesic.path_straightening(beta1, beta2, betamid=None, init='rand', T=100, k=5)[source]¬∂ >>>>>>> image

Perform path straightening to find geodesic between two shapes in either the space of closed curves or the space of affine standardized curves. This algorithm follows the steps outlined in section 4.6 of the manuscript.

Parameters

  • beta1 ‚Äì numpy ndarray of shape (2,M) of M samples (first curve)

  • beta2 ‚Äì numpy ndarray of shape (2,M) of M samples (end curve)

  • betamid ‚Äì numpy ndarray of shape (2,M) of M samples (mid curve Default = None, only needed for init ‚Äúgeod‚Äù)

  • init ‚Äì initialize path geodesic or random (Default = ‚Äúrand‚Äù)

  • T ‚Äì Number of samples of curve (Default = 100)

  • k ‚Äì number of samples along path (Default = 5)

Return type

numpy ndarray

Return dist

geodesic distance

Return path

geodesic path

Return pathsqnc

geodesic path sequence

Return E

energy
